nodes.text: Well this is intimidating. Formidable, even.
It looks like something the Gogs have put together. It's basically just a bunch of really sharp, pointed sticks lashed together to make a wall.
It's really sturdy and reaches practically all the way to the ceiling. I can't just climb it. I don't have the time to disassemble it before more Gogs come around.
It's very faint... but I think I can make out the echoes of a shanty and some shambling. What an odd combination! Especially with the bits of groaning here and there...
Eh, it's no good, I can't hear much of anything. There's too much echo in these caverns.
I'm not sure this is a good idea. I mean, it just looks so pointy...
<sigh> ... fine. I'll give it one try.
Whoa! That almost cut me!
Ouch! Who knew wood could be so sharp!
Ugh... I've got splinters in my hands. Climbing is just too dangerous.
I'm not trying that again.
If I want to get past this barrier, I'm going to have to destroy it.
There's a great idea! I'll burn this wall to the ground!
Wood, meet fire.
Yikes! The liquid isn't igniting... it's just... boiling? It's like it's too watery or something.
Well, that's too bad. I guess a Flambe isn't going to cut it.
I'm betting a little boom can go a long way.
Any moment now...
Um... that didn't sound too effective.
The explosion singed the wall a little, but it wasn't nearly powerful enough to do any real damage. It's almost like there's some kind of magic protecting it from minor explosions.
One Big Boom, coming up!
Wow!
It disintegrated the whole thing! Amazing!

nodes.message: TODO: Comment if there were gogs that left after the barrier destruction.

nodes.text: I guess I blew any magic away with my Boom.
Neat! There's definitely some magic here.
It's some sort of watery protection shield placed upon the wood... It makes the wood of the gate resistant to fire. I guess the Gogs must have had some issues with the torches being so close...
I'm not going to be able to get through this without something that packs a real wallop.
It's definitely some kind of watery protection magic, but I can't really tell what it's meant to do.
